Package com.behreajj.camzup.core

Class CurveEntity2

java.lang.Object
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Entity
com.behreajj.camzup.core.Entity2
com.behreajj.camzup.core.CurveEntity2
All Implemented Interfaces:
IOriented2, ISpatial2, ISvgWritable, IVolume, IVolume2, Comparable<Entity2>, Iterable<Curve2>
public class CurveEntity2 extends Entity2 implements Iterable<Curve2>, IVolume2, ISvgWritable
An entity which contains a transform that is applied to a list of curves.

    • eval

      public static Knot2 eval(CurveEntity2 ce, int curveIndex, float step, Knot2 knWorld, Knot2 knLocal)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] for a curve in the entity, returning a knot.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      curveIndex - the curve index
      step - the step
      knWorld - the knot in world space
      knLocal - the knot in local space
      Returns:
      the world knot
      See Also:
      • Curve2.eval(Curve2, float, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Transform2.mulPoint(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • eval

      public static Ray2 eval(CurveEntity2 ce, int curveIndex, float step, Ray2 rayWorld, Ray2 rayLocal)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] for a curve in the entity, returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      curveIndex - the curve index
      step - the step
      rayWorld - the output world ray
      rayLocal - the output local ray
      Returns:
      the world ray
      See Also:
      • eval(CurveEntity2, int, float, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • eval

      public static Vec2 eval(CurveEntity2 ce, int curveIndex, float step, Vec2 coWorld, Vec2 tnWorld, Vec2 coLocal, Vec2 tnLocal)
      Evaluates a step in the range [0.0, 1.0] for a curve in the entity, returning a coordinate on the curve and a tangent. The tangent will be normalized, to be of unit length.
      Parameters:
      ce - the curve entity
      curveIndex - the curve index
      step - the step
      coWorld - the output world coordinate
      tnWorld - the output world tangent
      coLocal - the output local coordinate
      tnLocal - the output local tangent
      Returns:
      the world coordinate
      See Also:
      • Curve2.eval(Curve2, float, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Transform2.mulPoint(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Transform2.mulDir(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • reframe

      public CurveEntity2 reframe()
      Centers and rescales all curves in the entity about a shared origin by calculating their dimensions, subtracting the center point, and scaling by the maximum dimension.
      Returns:
      this curve entity.
      See Also:
      • Curve2.accumMinMax(Curve2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • relocateKnot

      public CurveEntity2 relocateKnot(int curveIndex, int knotIndex, Vec2 global, Vec2 local)
      Relocates a knot within the curve to a point in global space. The point is inverse multiplied by the transform to put it in local space.
      Parameters:
      curveIndex - the curve index
      knotIndex - the knot index
      global - the point in global space
      local - the point in curve local space
      Returns:
      this entity
      See Also:
      • Transform2.invMulPoint(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)
      • Curve2.relocateKnot(int, Vec2)

    • setKnotCoord

      public CurveEntity2 setKnotCoord(int curveIndex, int knotIndex, Vec2 global, Vec2 local)
      Sets the coordinate of a knot for a given curve at an index. Multiplies the input coordinate in global space by the transform's inverse.

      To facilitate editing the curve with a graphical user interface (GUI).
      Parameters:
      curveIndex - the curve index
      knotIndex - the knot index
      global - the point in global space
      local - the point in curve local space
      Returns:
      this entity
      See Also:
      • Transform2.invMulPoint(Transform2, Vec2, Vec2)

    • toBlenderCode

      public String toBlenderCode()
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 4.x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes, i.e., to compare how curve geometry looks in Blender (the control) versus in the library (the test).
      Returns:
      the string

    • toBlenderCode

      public String toBlenderCode(int uRes, String fillMode, float extrude, float bevelDepth)
      Returns a String of Python code targeted toward the Blender 4.x API. This code is brittle and is used for internal testing purposes, i.e., to compare how curve geometry looks in Blender (the control) versus in the library (the test).
      Parameters:
      uRes - the resolution u
      fillMode - the fill mode: "BACK", "BOTH", "FRONT", "NONE"
      extrude - geometry extrusion amount
      bevelDepth - depth of geometry extrusion bevel
      Returns:
      the string

    • toOrigin

      public CurveEntity2 toOrigin()
      Centers all curves in the entity about a shared origin by calculating their dimensions then subtracting the center point.
      Returns:
      this curve entity.

    • toSvgElm

      public String toSvgElm(float zoom)
      Creates a string representing a group node in the SVG format.

      Stroke weight is impacted by scaling in transforms, so zoom is a parameter. If nonuniform zooming is used, zoom can be an average of width and height or the maximum dimension.
      Specified by:
      toSvgElm in interface ISvgWritable
      Parameters:
      zoom - scaling from external transforms
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgElm

      public String toSvgElm(float zoom, boolean useSubPaths, String strokeCap, String strokeJoin, int miterLimit, MaterialSolid material)
      Creates a string representing a group node in the SVG format.
      Parameters:
      zoom - scaling from external transforms
      useSubPaths - whether to use sub paths
      strokeCap - the stroke cap
      strokeJoin - the stroke join
      miterLimit - the miter limit
      material - the material to use
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgElm

      public String toSvgElm(float zoom, boolean useSubPaths, String strokeCap, String strokeJoin, int miterLimit, MaterialSolid[] materials)
      Creates a string representing a group node in the SVG format. This SVG is designed for compatibility with Processing, not for efficiency.

      Stroke weight is impacted by scaling in transforms, so zoom is a parameter. If nonuniform zooming is used, zoom can be an average of width and height or the maximum dimension.

      If sub paths is true, then a curve entity will contain one path element with multiple move to commands.
      Parameters:
      zoom - scaling from external transforms
      useSubPaths - whether to use sub paths
      strokeCap - the stroke cap
      strokeJoin - the stroke join
      miterLimit - the miter limit
      materials - the array of materials
      Returns:
      the string

    • toSvgString

      public String toSvgString()
      Renders this curve entity as an SVG string. A default material renders the curve's fill and stroke. The background of the SVG is transparent. Sets the camera scale to 1.0.
      Specified by:
      toSvgString in interface ISvgWritable
      Returns:
      the SVG string
